name: In re Jamie HALLIDAY, A Minor. Appeal of CHILDREN AND YOUTH SERVICES OF ALLEGHENY COUNTY

judges: Before ROBERTS, NIX, LARSEN, FLAHERTY, McDER-MOTT, HUTCHINSON and ZAPPALA, JJ.
parties: In re Jamie HALLIDAY, A Minor. Appeal of CHILDREN AND YOUTH SERVICES OF ALLEGHENY COUNTY.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
Order of the Superior Court, 302 Pa. Super. 560, 448 A.2d 1155 affirmed.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

attorneys: James H. McLean, County Sol., James A. Esler, Cheryl Allen Craig, Allegheny County Law Dept., Pittsburgh, for appellant.
Edward Van Stevenson, Jr., Neighborhood Legal Services, Mark P. Cancilla, Child Advocacy Legal Aid Soc., Pittsburgh, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
465 A.2d 640
In re Jamie HALLIDAY, A Minor. Appeal of CHILDREN AND YOUTH SERVICES OF ALLEGHENY COUNTY.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued Sept. 12, 1983.
Decided Sept. 23, 1983.
James H. McLean, County Sol., James A. Esler, Cheryl Allen Craig, Allegheny County Law Dept., Pittsburgh, for appellant.
Edward Van Stevenson, Jr., Neighborhood Legal Services, Mark P. Cancilla, Child Advocacy Legal Aid Soc., Pittsburgh, for appellee.
Before ROBERTS, NIX, LARSEN, FLAHERTY, McDER-MOTT, HUTCHINSON and ZAPPALA, JJ.
